meanings.definition: To go around in search of amusement or pleasure.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys gallivanting in the park with her friends.
meanings.sent2: On weekends, they often go gallivanting in the city.
meanings.sent3: The cat was gallivanting around the house, chasing shadows.
meanings.sent4: His mind was gallivanting through memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The children were gallivanting through the meadow, laughing and playing.

meanings.sent1: The dog was gallivanting through the neighborhood, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: After finishing his work, he spent the afternoon gallivanting in the woods.
meanings.sent3: She found herself gallivanting through the library, picking random books to read.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were gallivanting like butterflies, flitting from one idea to another.
meanings.sent5: The old man could be seen gallivanting along the beach, lost in his own world.
